TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program 2 is heading to PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S

Articles.Content:
Coming in 2022, Kerbal Space Program 2 will launch on PC via Steam and other digital storefronts, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox One consoles. 

More details coming at a later date.
So on the 1st of Januar, cool!!!

2 minutes ago, KerbMav said:

So on the 1st of Januar, cool!!!

Let's say in time for Xmas instead

Big woop. What about (native) Linux?

And this had BETTER not trigger a UI dumb-down to cater for the consoles..   

Please don't get me wrong, I also love console gaming, but some games are more suited to controller+TV gaming and others more suited to a full PC experience. KSP, IMHO, is far more suited to PC gaming and I am very very tired of "Lowest Common Denominator" development.  A few of my favourite games have been significantly affected when console support was added - and not for the better. Thankfully KSP1 stuck to its original UI even after the console ports

Why is it still planed for the old consoles? They are only holding back everything with their extremly weak CPUs and low RAM. Supporting them will keep KSP2 stuck on old Hardware forever, as they cant drop support later.

Nice! What about a native Linux version? Would really like to have that, and it seems like I'm not alone with this... Linux gaming may be a small market overall, but the KSP community apparently has a rather large number of active players and modders who use Linux (which is to be expected considering the type and target audience of the game ...).
